Online Yoga Philosophy classes

Learn about the essence of Yoga

Join us on an eye-opening journey of discovering yoga as one of India´s ancient philosophical systems. Evolving over 5 millennia it is more relevant today than we might imagine.

Starting from the roots we will understand and discuss the most relevant texts and concepts, ultimately applying them to our daily life on and off the mat.

It is more than physical practice.

Most of today´s practitioners get to know Yoga as a physical practice. And this is a beautiful way to start an amazing journey often meant to last a lifetime.

But it is so much more. Yoga is an ancient science, which established around a question we all might ask sooner or later: Who are we? It is the journey of the self to ultimately uncover your true self.

In search for truth early Yogis started practicing different techniques leading to the evolution of consciousness .  Over many years Yoga evolved. Being traditionally passed on from guru to disciple over many years of intense practice, and a sacred bond,  Patanjali was one of the first Saints who wrote down systematically how Yoga should be practiced.

In our online classes you will learn about the origins of Yoga, its philosophical system of concepts, and you will be introduced to different techniques for a regular, holistic self-practice.

The school

Devvrat Yoga stands for the true value of Yoga as a holistic system leading to an overall development of the self. Walking the path of this ancient practice has the true power to transform not only your own life, but the life of many, and ultimately the entire world. Yoga brings peace of mind, freedom of the self and hope for humanity. Read more about Yogi Devvrat.

Why Yoga philosophy?

Yoga does not stop at the end of your physical practice. Studying it as a philosophical system will help you understand its true purpose.

Practicing Yoga in a holistic approach will not only comfort and heal your body, but it is capable to lead you to a better understanding of your own self.

What you will take away from the course

  • learn about the roots of Yoga and how it evolved over thousands of years
  • understand the approach to Yoga as a holistic science and philosophical system
  • learn about Patanjali´s 8 limbs of Yoga and their relevance until today
  • study essential Sutras of Patanjali and apply them to your own practice
  • your teachers are available via e-mail and skype to discuss open questions
  • hand in assignments and get individual feedback
  • deepen your Yoga practice with tailored sequences, Pranayama as well as meditation techniques

Be flexible with times, topics, and questions

Our course is divided in 5 modules. It is your decision which modules you would like to study and you are always welcome to add more.

You are not able to join our live sessions? No problem. We record every class and make it accessible for you 24/7.

We offer you Q&As via e-mail or skype. If you would like to dive deeper into a certain topic, we can offer you individual sessions via skype.

Module 1 – Introduction to Yoga philosophy (2h)

We will follow back the traces of Yoga and find out where it derived from originally.

You will get an overview of the 6 main philosophies in India. We will have a closer look at Samkhya as one of these, and study its relevance for the development of Yoga.

We will discuss the question what Yoga is – today and originally and learn about its connection with the vedas.

Module 2 – Ashtanga Yoga after Patanjali (3h)

Understand the 8 limbs of Yoga by Patanjali and learn about their relevance for today´s life on and off the mat. You can choose a topic to write an assignment on and get the chance to discuss these in one of our life sessions with Devvrat and your fellow students.

Module 3 – Patanjali´s Yoga Sutras (4h)

We will get to know Saint Patanjali, one of the key figures of Yoga history. In talks and discussions you will learn about his systematical documentation of Ashtanga Yoga known under the name of Patanjali´s Yoga Sutras. Yoga Sutra is having 196 sutra and divided in four chapters.

Chapter -1 Samadhi Pada

Chapter -2 Sadhana Pada

Chapter-3 Vibhooti Pada

Chapter-4 Kaivalya Pada

It will be very hard to progress in yoga without understanding Patanjali Yoga Sutra. It throws light on each and every aspect of yoga not just asana or physical practice.In this Session ,We will connect philosophical & scientific approach of yoga with the physical practice and find ways to apply the Sutras on the mat as well as in daily situations.

Module 4 – Bhagavad Gita and Yoga (4h)

The Bhagavad Gita teaches a lot about Yoga. We will have a closer look at certain chapters, analyse, and understand its relevance – yesterday and today.. It gives complete view about not just yoga but also about our personal life , social conduct and about our whole cosmic existence. Bhagavad Gita have total 700 verses divided in 18 chapters.

In this four hours session, we will highlight only those sutras which are closely related to yoga practice and provide gist of whole Bhagavad Gita.

Module 5 – Theory Behind OM(2h)

OM Chanting has very important place in yoga practice. Almost all ancient Indian Scripters accept importance of OM and describe it in various way. Specially  Vedas, Upnisads and Patanjali Yoga sutra  explains about OM and describe its significances.

Some scripture says just by chanting OM one can attend Kaivalya(Self Realization) other says it is sound of universe and very first Mantra.Patanjali says that OM is indicating Supreme Consciousness who is responsible for all cosmic creation. By meditating upon OM one can experience Samadhi(enlightenment).

Gist is same in all scriptures only explained in different way.

In this Session , we will Learn:

  1. How to chant OM properly?
  2. What is Physics behind OM and how it works?
  3. How OM can recharge our whole body?
  4. How Upnisad & Patanjali Yoga Sutra Explain OM?
  5. How Chanting OM can Lead to experience beyond space-time?
